channel.title: Alright, I'll try again. Delta source problems
channel.description:
Ok, well I need some help with coding delta. There are 4 main things needed, and some other stuff as well.
1) Make shops talk (like they say which shop they re) [s]2) Change the exp rates for ALL skills[/s] - Done [s]3) Move portals[/s] - Done [s]4) Make players start in a new area, and with different starting gear[/s] - Done
Along with these I would need to make a new home area, and skilling area, and moving the skilling stuff to the new skilling area.
Thats basically it. If you feel like adding me my msn is FlubbyC@hotmail.com
Thanks for the help.

item.title: Alright, I'll try again. Delta source problems
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“own-u, post:9, topic:318040”][quote author=pk3r john link=topic=414549.msg3051977#msg3051977 date=1260140485]
For making shop owners talk, you’d add the code into npchandler.java. I don’t have the code myself, but just to narrow it down.

Also, rep++ for being smart and actually making a list instead of a thread for every problem.

EDIT: What the person above me said, but op said it’s delta, so here’s a revised version:

if (npcs[i].npcType == YOUR NPC ID HERE) {
if (c.misc.random(30) == 2) { //how often your npc talks
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = "YOUR TEXT HERE";
    }
}

Might not be that, you might have to add a few more c. to it. I haven’t programmed a delta in like 3 months so I can’t remember off the top of my head.
[/quote]

Thank for rep++

Question though, where we are supposed to put how often the npcs talk, do we put like 10? And do we keep the \??[/quote]

Making the 30 lower means that you’ll get it more often, and making it higher means more rare.
Also, it’s hard to define what the 2 means, but it doesn’t make a big deal anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Alright, I'll try again. Delta source problems
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

For making shop owners talk, you’d add the code into npchandler.java. I don’t have the code myself, but just to narrow it down.

Also, rep++ for being smart and actually making a list instead of a thread for every problem.

EDIT: What the person above me said, but op said it’s delta, so here’s a revised version:

if (npcs[i].npcType == YOUR NPC ID HERE) {
if (c.misc.random(30) == 2) { //how often your npc talks
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = "YOUR TEXT HERE";
    }
}

Might not be that, you might have to add a few more c. to it. I haven’t programmed a delta in like 3 months so I can’t remember off the top of my head.

item.title: Alright, I'll try again. Delta source problems
item.dc:creator: @mag3_0wner mag3 0wner
item.description:
@mag3_0wner wrote:

In Npchandler.java add this

if (npcs[i].npcType == YOUR NPC ID HERE) { if (misc.random(30) == 2) { //how often your npc talks npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "YOUR TEXT HERE"; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Alright, I'll try again. Delta source problems
item.dc:creator: @farrukhrockz farrukhrockz
item.description:
@farrukhrockz wrote:

for xp rates you have to go to client.java and you have to know ur current rate and search it up then just replace it.
to make them start in a new place its almost the same as first find the coords of the place they currently appear and search it up. Then replace it with the coords you want.
portals has to do with adding objects. Just go to client.java and add it there.

Read full topic
